info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 15 at 3:37AM MST until February 16 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WINTER STORM TO BRING HEAVY SNOW TO PORTIONS OF THE MOUNTAINS AND PLAINS... .A winter storm will bring snow, heavy at times to most areas roughly along and south of I-70 today. The heaviest snow is expected in the mountains surrounding Park County, the southern foothills, the Palmer Divide (including I-25 between Denver and Colorado Springs), and possibly portions of I-70 through the plains. Snow will be heaviest this morning, with lighter snow lingering much of this afternoon and evening. In addition, gusty winds will lead to localized blowing snow concerns especially across the plains and Lincoln county. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Snow ongoing. Additional snow accumulations between 2 and 7 inches with the lesser amounts further north. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...The Northern Front Range Foothills, Greeley, and Fort Morgan. * WHEN...Until Midnight MST tonight. * IMPACTS...Roads will likely become slick and hazardous. Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.
